title: By-elections: Tory gloom deepens after double poll blow
description: The added political spice that garnishes the Tory gloom today is the performance of Reform UK. I'm typing this in a café in Wellingborough, in Northamptonshire, where this morning Reform candidate and deputy leader Ben Habib has been on a victory lap.

title: Labour ready for difficult decisions in new age of insecurity, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer will insist Labour can deliver ‘security for decades’ as he addresses his party’s Scottish conference in Glasgow on Sunday.

title: Nigel Farage flirts with political comeback after Reform UK by-election success
description: While the party is still polling around 10 per cent nationally, its electoral prospects could see a major boost if Mr Farage returns to the fold. The former Ukip leader is currently the president of Reform UK, which counts businessman and arch Brexiteer Richard Tice as its leader.

title: Farage weighs up mass legal fight against banks as 3,000 tell him: They closed our accounts too
description: The scale of Britain's 'debanking scandal' was last night revealed after nearly 3,000 people claimed their accounts have been unexpectedly closed.

description: Although I now live in California, I was in the UK when the verdicts were reached in the Brianna Ghey murder trial. I couldn't believe what I was hearing as I watched the coverage.

title: Venues ‘should ban political events’ over car policy

title: Former South Africa and Gloucestershire all-rounder Mike Procter dies aged 77
description: Former South Africa all-rounder Mike Procter, the first man to coach his country after their post-Apartheid return to international cricket, has died at the age of 77.

title: The theme and A-list hosts for the 2024 Met Gala have officially been announced
description: The 2024 Met Gala is officially within sight, with this year's Costume Institute Benefit falling on May 6 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The annual event - undoubtedly the most iconic in the fashion calendar, is most known for its red carpet, with an official dress code announced each year.

title: Greens criticised for ‘perverse’ call to ban Israel from sporting and music events
description: The Green Party has been criticised for a “perverse and wrong-headed” social media post calling for Israel to be banned from international sporting and music events. On Friday, the Greens posted a political advert on X, formerly known as Twitter, describing the actions it said were necessary to “stop the killing in Gaza”.

title: Ukraine war: 'Artificial shortage' of weapons helps Putin, says Zelensky
description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky has made an urgent appeal for more weapons to avoid a "catastrophic" situation in Europe. An "artificial deficit of weapons" will only help Russia, Mr Zelensky told an international conference in Germany.

title: Hundreds of steelworkers protest against job losses
description: It could lead to the loss of around 2,800 jobs as it switches to a more environmentally friendly way of producing steel. Tata also employs hundreds of workers at its plant in Shotton where they take the product from Port Talbot and add value with paint and zinc.

title: Anas Sarwar reveals toll Islamophobia has taken on his family
description: Mr Sarwar previously addressed the Islamophobia his father Mohammed received as Britain’s first Muslim MP. He has often recounted one of his first encounters with racism – discovering an envelope on the family doormat with mocked-up images inside of his mother tied to a chair with two guns pointed at her head.
